page.title: 15LITTLE WITLEY HORTICULTURE-2
page.content: {Tomatoes}are cropped between April and October at 100 tons per acre A.Y.R. Unrooted cuttings of {chrysanthemums}are purchased from Malta, South Africa and Tenerife and are cropped 3-5 times each year. {Spraying}of all crops is kept to a minimum, but is still needed to ensure healthy crops.{Biological control}of pests is now practical using parasite predator and fungicidal treatments. Chrysanthemums are{marketed}either to local shops or sold in bulk through wholesale marketed. Tomatoes and lettuce are all sold through G.M.S., a grower owned Cooperative. This was found essential to maximise returns from the market place. The present {labour force}consists of 6 full-time, 2 part-time with 4-6 casual workers in summer. The{future}is uncertain due to heavy pressure from EEC imports.
